intro: Pomaria glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular pomaria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are ovate and often have glandular dots, giving it its scientific name. Pomaria glandulosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
